title: Shooting ruled accidental discharge
content:
Rockwall Police Department investigators have determined the shooting of a 17-year-old on Sept. 13 was caused by an accidental discharge of a weapon.
Police, according to Chief Kirk Riggs, received a call from the boy’s father that he was en route to Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital-Rockwall with his son, who had been shot while walking home.
Officers were sent to the hospital at 8:23 p.m. as well as Faircrest Drive where the shooting allegedly took place.
Police at the hospital were told by an emergency room doctor it appeared the boy had been shot in the lower abdomen. The victim was take by CareFlite helicopter to Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital in Dallas.
The 17-year-old, according to Riggs, attends Rockwall Heath High School.
“At the time of the initial report, there was very limited information provided by the victim on how the alleged shooting occurred and no physical description of a suspect was given,” Riggs said in a press release. “Based on the initial investigation, investigators believed this was an isolated incident and there was no threat to the general public.
“The investigation has now been completed and it was determined the gunshot wound was a result of an accidental discharge of a firearm by the victim and there were no other persons involved,” Riggs said. “The investigation is closed and there are no criminal charges being filed in regards to this incident.”
